Legal_Issue: Appropriate penalty for contempt due to non-compliance with court order
Evidence_Assessment: Defendant knowingly continued trademark use despite injunction and warnings
Decision_Outcome: Financial penalties imposed with conditional reduction; suspended sentence
Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiff to prove contempt, shifted upon defendant's plea
Credibility_Factor: Defendant pleaded guilty, no denial of conduct
Legal_Rule: Courts may impose fines, imprisonment, or costs for contempt; aggravating and mitigating factors considered
Grounds_for_Claim: Violation of permanent injunction prohibiting trademark infringement
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Not applicable â€“ original decision, not under review
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Defendant had opportunity to comply, received warnings, pleaded guilty
Key_Evidence_Considered: Permanent injunction, evidence of continued trademark use, settlement offers, delay in compliance
Legal_Framework: Contempt powers under Federal Courts Rules
Applicant_Challenge: Enforcement of judgment and imposition of penalties
Court_Result: Solicitor-client costs ($62,000), fine ($50,000 reducible to $10,000), suspended 14-day sentence
Standard_of_Proof: Clear and convincing evidence, satisfied by guilty plea
Defendant_Response: Pleaded guilty to contempt, delayed compliance, no apology
Remedy_Requested: Enforcement of injunction, financial penalties, potential imprisonment
Outcome: Significant financial penalties with conditional reduction; suspended sentence for non-payment
Applicable_Process: Contempt proceedings following breach of court order
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Payment of costs and fine to avoid full penalty
